messages.title: Local businesses opposed to Labour's job tax
messages.content: Businesses express concerns over Labour’s national insurance rise.

messages.title: H&F CONSERVATIVE COUNCIL A RECORD TO BE PROUD OF
messages.content: Council tax freeze for four years, satisfaction with council services high, new school opening, crime rates down, improved street cleaning services, and enhancements in local transportation.

messages.title: Crime down - but more to do
messages.content: Crime rates have decreased in Hammersmith & Fulham by 18% over the past 2 years.

messages.title: Getting Britain working
messages.content: Conservatives support businesses to create more jobs and oppose job tax increase.

messages.title: Labour’s local debt
messages.content: Underlining the debt issues caused by the Labour council.

messages.title: Labour's national debt
messages.content: Criticizing the national debt under Labour's governance.

messages.title: Can you afford to let Labour back in?
messages.content: Highlighting concerns about the economic implications if Labour is voted back into office.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Conservatives oppose the rise in Labour's national insurance which impacts local businesses and job creation.
Conservatives pledge to combat both national and local levels of debt, emphasizing financial responsibility.
Conservatives highlight their success in reducing crime but recognize there is more to do.
Promoting new education options like the opening of new schools.
Mention the opening of new tube lines and improvements in local transportation.

mentions.candidate: Shaun Bailey is featured and named as a candidate for MP.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: The Labour Party is mentioned critically in regards to their economic policies.

issues.economy: Conservatives propose to support businesses and oppose Labour's national insurance rise. Concerns about the national and local debt under Labour.
issues.education: Highlighting the council's achievements in opening new schools and providing better educational facilities.
issues.governance: Conservatives showcase their council record and criticize Labour's handling of finances.

images.caption: Images of Shaun Bailey with locals, Conservative Council achievements, and local Conservative Party activists.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet promotes Shaun Bailey for MP, Gavin Donovan, Peter Graham, and Andrew Johnson for local councillors. It emphasizes the Conservative Council's achievements and compares them with Labour’s performance nationally and locally, warning against the economic consequences of Labour's policies.
